topics.body: For those annoyed by the drama in this pony fandom, I can tell you that the _Jurassic Park_ fandom is a drama hive as well.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3ccc636872434c560100#post_534e3ccc636872434c560100
The jurassic park fandom is still alive?  I thought they were extinct.

I can understand why they would be so filled with drama considering how much jurassic park got wrong about dinosaurs.  The original was a good film, *but* the dinosaurs weren't even actually dinosaurs when you thought about it.

Jurassic park:
!http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20070315192616/jurassicpark/images/2/27/JP-WhenDinosaursRuled.jpg!

What dinosaurs probably looked like:
!http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/d_f/featherdino.jpg!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3dd66368722698350200#post_534e3dd66368722698350200
Yeah, me too.
I thought they died of a meteor or something.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3dd66368722698350200#post_534e3dd66368722698350200
Check out JPToys and Jurassic Park Legacy, as well as Trescom. It's still alive, but goes through a lot of drama, especially surrounding Hasbro's toylines and how they are bad compared to Kenner's, and around _Jurassic World_, and debates on how good the sequels are. JPL actually had to ban _T. rex_ vs. _Spinosaurus_ debates because of the shitstorms they caused.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3dd66368722698350200#post_534e3dd66368722698350200
There is a lot of drama about that too. Lots of dinosaur fans are butthurt about the feather discoveries.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3e5e636872145ef60200#post_534e3e5e636872145ef60200
That's technically half true.

For tens of millions of years dinosaurs were already going extinct because they were so large that the ecosystem couldn't support them and smaller animals were already taking their place anyhow; when the meteor hit they went click dead cause of their dietary needs could no longer be supported in any measure.  Technically it wasn't the meteor that killed them, but the ecosystem collapse that resulted of it that killed them off.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3feb6368721c19660300#post_534e3feb6368721c19660300
Not true. Dinosaurs were actually pretty successful animals, although there is some evidence of a decline towards the end of the Cretaceous.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e3feb6368721c19660300#post_534e3feb6368721c19660300
I always thought the meteor changed the ecosystem (weather patterns mostly) somehow and killed them.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e40796368721c19d70300#post_534e40796368721c19d70300
Well we know for certain the meteor was the final straw that killed them.  The question is what caused the massive population decline beforehand though.  Were they just impossible for the environment to maintain that many or was it volcanic activities changing the environment in ways they could no longer adapt to or was it cause of rising sea levels?  At the end of the cretaceous period a lot of them were already experiencing a extinction event anyhow.

It's like a guy in a burning building breathing in smoke and getting burned and getting crushed by a industrial AC that falls on him; did he burned to death, was it smoke inhalation or did the AC kill him?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e423963687237f4090100#post_534e423963687237f4090100
Well, the Deccan Traps (a group of prehistoric volcanoes in India) probably also contributed to their extinction. I think that if you left one of these factors out, some non-avian dinosaurs would have survived.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
The whole "submissive asian women" thing is a myth. Even traditional asian born women aren't submissive.

I always suspected it was a pernicious lie conceived by katana fetishists.

topics.body:
If aliens do exist (probability: extremely high), I want to meet one.
I also want to travel through space and write a book about it.

I wonder, who made the idea of aliens probing people and stuff?

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534e517d6368726f55430000#post_534e517d6368726f55430000
Same here; I'm one of those weird people that if aliens or whatever exists my gut reaction would be to pull them into a interview table and then ask them for their life story.

You could walk me into the Men in Black headquarters and proceed to show me everything and my reaction would be along the lines of:
!http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-qkcxBLTA-bg/UfmLCnKQ84I/AAAAAAAAFRM/eLhp_Y59NkE/s1600/gg_Shingeki_no_Kyojin_-_15_31610C3Dmkv_snapshot_1051_20130727_195725.jpg!
Do you wanna build a biblio?
Come on lets go and write
I've never see you before
Come in the door
. . .
Do you wanna build a biblio?
It doesn't have to be a biblio.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Some more news and it's kind of ironic:
For those living in the usa you know how a couple assbackwards states in the south tried to pass "religious freedom" bills that would allow for businesses to discriminate against glbt. . Well these bills had the exact opposite effect of what the lawmakers' intentions; businesses are now sticking up "we don't discriminate" stickers on their businesses and as a result are seeing a increase in business from people who support glbt rights and companies that are anti-glbt are actually experiencing a decline in sales.

+1 faith in humanity

Karma's a bitch isn't she?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534ecf506368720ee7090000#post_534ecf506368720ee7090000
Fucking yes. You know, I totally support the right of people to me bigots. Those bakeries in Arizona? I'm fine with them not wanting to cater gay weddings, bigot cake probably tastes like ass anyways.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534ed1e46368723790820000#post_534ed1e46368723790820000
At this point it's pretty official that the anti-glbt rights movement is on life support.  They keep losing while states keep legalizing gay marriage, they keep losing court battles, 60% of americans support glbt rights whereas only 34% oppose it(opposition at this point is shrinking month by month), they keep losing legislation wise and now they're losing economically.

Even texas gay marriage ban was struck down and is now going towards the appeals court; it's going to be a couple months until the court decision is decided.  At this point it's extremely likely that same-sex marriage will be legal in all fifty states of the usa by the end of 2016.

It's like watching someone get in a bar fight and getting his ass handed to him on a silver plate while still going, "It's not over yet!"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

Depends. There are people in the fandom making _Trespasser_ mods, which are essentially improving it. Just google "Trescom".

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534f53c56368722c2b190000#post_534f53c56368722c2b190000
Improving it is heresy, that game is a comedy gold mine in all its buggy, broken glory. It is nothing less than the gaming equivalent of Plan 9 From Outerspace.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
Another notable drama in the JP fandom is how Hasbro made the toys compared to how Kenner made the toys. Kenner made the JP toys originally, until Hasbro bought them. This is what the Kenner toys were like:
!http://dinotoyblog.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/05/JPRex.jpg!
!http://www.dinosaur-toys-collectors-guide.com/images/Triceratops-Dinosaur-Toys-Jurassic-JP08B1.jpg!
!http://www.jptoys.com/toy-database/jurassic-park/jurassic-park-series-2/dinosaurs/utahraptor/img/utahraptor.jpg!
!http://www.jptoys.com/toy-database/lost-world/lost-world-series-1/dinosaurs/thrasher-rex/img/thrasher3.jpg!

However, when Hasbro came along, they fired all the Kenner staff and ended up making the JP3 toys.
!http://www.jptoys.com/toy-database/jurassic-park-3/dinosaurs/spinosaurus/img/spinosaurus2.jpg!
!http://www.jptoys.com/toy-database/jurassic-park-3/dinosaurs/alpha-raptor/img/alpharaptor2.jpg!
!http://www.jptoys.com/toy-database/jurassic-park-3/dinosaurs/brachiosaurus/img/brachiosaurus2.jpg!

Notice any difference in style? Kenner's toys were bigger, often very playable, and overall awesome. Hasbro's toys were smaller, less playable due to their non-neutral poses, and their dino-damage wounds couldn't even be covered up. So needless to say, it caused a lot of drama among fans.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097
